snippet: Libyan officials denounced the operation to capture a senior Qaeda militant, but American officials say the raid, and another to seize a suspect in the 2011 attack on a diplomatic mission, had Libya’s tacit approval.
abstract: Libyan officials denounce American commando operation to capture senior Al Qaeda militant Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, but American officials say the raid, and another to seize a suspect in the 2012 attack on a diplomatic mission, had Libya’s tacit approval; backlash against second raid could bring down government of Libyan Prime Min Ali Zeidan, which has teetered on brink of collapse.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: David D. Kilpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Libyan officials denounced the operation to capture a senior Qaeda militant, but American officials say the raid, and another to seize a suspect in the 2011 attack on a diplomatic mission, had Libya’s tacit approval.

headline.main: U.S. Officials Say Libya Approved Commando Raids
headline.print_headline: U.S. Officials Say Libya Approved Commando Raids

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
